required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Sleepware G3 Autoscoring Algorithm
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of Sleepware G3 Autoscoring Algorithm

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to validate the ability of the Sleepware G3 polysomnography software platform to correctly identify and score sleep related events.

clinical_study.why_stopped: De-identified PSGs were to be scored by a vendor prior to being sent to the sponsor. Issues occurred with vendor and no PSGs were analyzed by the sponsor.

primary_outcome.description: The objective of this study is to validate the ability of the Sleepware G3 polysomnography software platform to correctly identify and score sleep related events. Specifically, the study will compare Sleepware autoscoring of respiratory events, sleep staging, leg movements, micro-arousals and desaturations, among possible others events, to manual scoring by two registered polysomnographic technologists (RPSGT).

arm_group.description: Retrospective, de-identified PSG studies will be collected and scored by registered polysomnogrpahy technicians. The manually scored studies will be compared to the automatic scoring performed by the new Sleepware Software G3 Autoscoring Algorithm.

intervention.description: No participants will be enrolled and no interventions, besides PSG scoring will be utilized.

study_pop.textblock: Any retrospective, de-identified adult polysomnogram collected using American Society of Sleep Medicine (AASM) criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- AASM Compliant PSG studies
Exclusion Criteria:
- NA
